account.orig: Is a width specifier, encoded in "option", where x11->X, otherwise W.

Is the extension to be applied to the second source operand, encoded in "option", where 000->UXTB, 001->UXTH, 010->LSL|UXTW, 011->UXTX, 100->SXTB, 101->SXTH, 110->SXTW, 111->SXTX. * If "Rd" or "Rn" is '11111' (WSP) and "option" is '010' then LSL is preferred, but may be omitted when "imm3" is '000'. In all other cases <extend> is required and must be UXTW when "option" is '010'.

definition.intro: Is the extension to be applied to the second source operand,
definition.after: If "Rd" or "Rn" is '11111' (WSP) and "option" is '010' then LSL is preferred, but may be omitted when "imm3" is '000'. In all other cases <extend> is required and must be UXTW when "option" is '010'.

In all other cases <extend> is required and must be UXTX when "option" is '011'.

account.orig: Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "Q", where 0->4H, 1->8H.
Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "Q:sz", where 10->4S, otherwise RESERVED.
Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "size:Q", where 000->8B, 001->16B, 010->4H, 011->8H and 101->4S, otherwise RESERVED.
Is the destination width specifier, encoded in "size", where 00->B, 01->H, 10->S and 11->RESERVED.

Is the destination width specifier, encoded in "sz", where 0->S and 1->RESERVED.
Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "imm5:Q", where xxxx10->8B, xxxx11->16B, xxx100->4H, xxx101->8H, xx1000->2S, xx1001->4S, x10000->RESERVED, x10001->2D, x0000x->RESERVED.
Is an element size specifier, encoded in "imm5", where xxxx1->B, xxx10->H, xx100->S, x1000->D, x0000->RESERVED.

Is the source element index encoded in "imm5:imm4", using "imm5", where xxxx1->imm4<3:0>, xxx10->imm4<3:1>, xx100->imm4<3:2>, x1000->imm4<3>, x0000->RESERVED. Unspecified bits in "imm4" are ignored but should be set to zero by an assembler.

account.orig: Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "Q:sz", where 00->2S, 10->4S, 11->2D, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "size", where 01->4S and 10->2D, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "size:Q", where 010->4H, 011->8H and 101->4S, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "size:Q", where 010->4H, 011->8H, 100->2S and 101->4S, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is an arrangement specifier, encoded in "size:Q", where 010->4H, 011->8H, 100->2S and 101->4S, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is an element size specifier, encoded in "size", where 01->H and 10->S, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is an element size specifier, encoded in "sz", where 0->S and 1->D.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is the bottom or top element specifier, encoded in "Q" where 0->B, 1->T.

definition.intro: Is the bottom or top element specifier,

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is the element index, encoded in "size:H:L", using "size", where 01->H:L and 10->H, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is the element index, encoded in "size:L:H:M", using "size", where 01->H:L:M and 10->H:L, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is the element index, encoded in "sz:L:H", using "sz:L", where 0x->H:L, 10->H, otherwise RESERVED.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is the name of the second SIMD&FP source register, encoded in the "size:M:Rm" fields, using "size" where 01->0:Rm and 10->M:Rm, otherwise RESERVED. Restricted to V0-V15 when element size <Ts> is H.

definition.intro: Is the name of the second SIMD&FP source register,
definition.after: Restricted to V0-V15 when element size <Ts> is H.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is the rotation, encoded in "rot", where 00->0, 01->90, 10->180 and 11->270.

account.iclass_long: Advanced SIMD vector x indexed element
account.orig: Is the second and upper half specifier. If present it causes the operation to be performed on the upper 64 bits of the registers holding the narrower elements, and is encoded in "Q", where 0->[absent] and 1->[present].

definition.intro: Is the second and upper half specifier. If present it causes the operation to be performed on the upper 64 bits of the registers holding the narrower elements, and is

account.orig: Is the type of indirection, encoded in "op2<2:1>", where 00->(omitted), 01->c, 10->j, 11->jc.
Is the index extend specifier, encoded in "option", where 010->UXTW, 110->SXTW, 111->SXTX.
Is the index extend/shift specifier, defaulting to LSL, and which must be omitted for the LSL option when <amount> is omitted. Encoded in "option", where 010->UXTW, 011->LSL, 110->SXTW, 111->SXTX.

definition.intro: Is the index extend/shift specifier, defaulting to LSL, and which must be omitted for the LSL option when <amount> is omitted.

account.orig: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is encoded in "S", where 0->#0, 1->#1.

definition.intro: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is

account.orig: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is encoded in "S", where 0->#0, 1->#2.

definition.intro: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is

account.orig: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is encoded in "S", where 0->#0, 1->#3.

definition.intro: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is

account.orig: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is encoded in "S", where 0->#0, 1->#4.

definition.intro: Is the index shift amount, optional only when <extend> is not LSL. Where it is permitted to be optional, it defaults to #0. It is

account.orig: Is the optional shift to be applied to the final source, defaulting to LSL and encoded in "shift", where 00->LSL, 01->LSR, 10->ASR, 11->ROR.

definition.intro: Is the optional shift to be applied to the final source, defaulting to LSL and

account.orig: Is a PSTATE field name. For the MSR instruction, this is encoded in "op1:op2:CRm", where 00000xxxxx->SEE(pstate), 000010xxxx->SEE(pstate), 000011xxxx->UAO (FEAT_UAO), 000100xxxx->PAN (FEAT_PAN), 000101xxxx->SPSel, 001000000x->ALLINT (FEAT_NMI), 011001xxxx->SSBS (FEAT_SSBS), 011010xxxx->DIT (FEAT_DIT), 011011001x->SVCRSM (FEAT_SME), 011011010x->SVCRZA (FEAT_SME), 011011011x->SVCRSMZA (FEAT_SME), 011100xxxx->TCO (FEAT_MTE), 011110xxxx->DAIFSet, 011111xxxx->DAIFClr, 001000001x->PM (FEAT_EBEP), otherwise RESERVED. For the SMSTART and SMSTOP aliases, this is encoded in "CRm<2:1>", where 0b01 specifies SVCRSM, 0b10 specifies SVCRZA, and 0b11 specifies SVCRSMZA.

definition.intro: Is a PSTATE field name. For the MSR instruction, this is
definition.after: For the SMSTART and SMSTOP aliases, this is encoded in "CRm<2:1>", where 0b01 specifies SVCRSM, 0b10 specifies SVCRZA, and 0b11 specifies SVCRSMZA.

account.orig: Is an optional mode, encoded in "CRm<2:1>", where 00->RESERVED, 01->SM, 10->ZA, 11->[no specifier].
Is a BRB instruction name, as listed for the BRB system instruction group, encoded in "op2", where 100->IALL (FEAT_BRBE), 101->INJ (FEAT_BRBE).

definition.intro: Is a BRB instruction name, as listed for the BRB system instruction group,

account.orig: Is a DC instruction name, as listed for the DC system instruction group, encoded in "op1:CRm:op2", where 0110100001->ZVA, 0000110001->IVAC, 0000110010->ISW, 0111010001->CVAC, 0111100001->CVAP (FEAT_DPB), 0111101001->CVADP (FEAT_DPB2), 0001010010->CSW, 0111011001->CVAU, 0111110001->CIVAC, 0001110010->CISW, 0000110011->IGVAC (FEAT_MTE2), 0000110100->IGSW (FEAT_MTE2), 0001010100->CGSW (FEAT_MTE2), 0001110100->CIGSW (FEAT_MTE2), 0111010011->CGVAC (FEAT_MTE), 0111100011->CGVAP (FEAT_MTE), 0111101011->CGVADP (FEAT_MTE), 0111110011->CIGVAC (FEAT_MTE), 0110100011->GVA (FEAT_MTE), 0000110101->IGDVAC (FEAT_MTE2), 0000110110->IGDSW (FEAT_MTE2), 0001010110->CGDSW (FEAT_MTE2), 0001110110->CIGDSW (FEAT_MTE2), 0111010101->CGDVAC (FEAT_MTE), 0111100101->CGDVAP (FEAT_MTE), 0111101101->CGDVADP (FEAT_MTE), 0111110101->CIGDVAC (FEAT_MTE), 0110100100->GZVA (FEAT_MTE), 1101110101->CIGDPAPA (FEAT_RME), 1101110001->CIPAPA (FEAT_RME), 1001110000->CIPAE (FEAT_MEC), 1001110111->CIGDPAE (FEAT_MEC).

definition.intro: Is a TLBI instruction name, as listed for the TLBI system instruction group,

account.orig: Is an AT instruction name, as listed for the AT system instruction group, encoded in the "op1:CRm<0>:op2", where 0000000->S1E1R, 0001000->S1E1RP (FEAT_PAN2), 1000000->S1E2R, 1100000->S1E3R, 0000001->S1E1W, 0001001->S1E1WP (FEAT_PAN2), 1000001->S1E2W, 1100001->S1E3W, 0000010->S1E0R, 0000011->S1E0W, 1000100->S12E1R, 1000101->S12E1W, 1000110->S12E0R, 1000111->S12E0W.

definition.intro: Is an AT instruction name, as listed for the AT system instruction group,

account.orig: Is an IC instruction name, as listed for the IC system instruction pages, encoded in "op1:CRm:op2", where 0000001000->IALLUIS, 0000101000->IALLU, 0110101001->IVAU.

definition.intro: Is an IC instruction name, as listed for the IC system instruction pages,
Is a TLBIP instruction name, as listed for the TLBIP system pair instruction group,

account.orig: Is an unsigned immediate, encoded in "o0", where 0->2, 1->3.
Is an unsigned immediate, encoded in "o0", where 0->2, 1->3.
Is a width specifier, encoded in "b5", where 1->X, 0->W. * In assembler source code an 'X' specifier is always permitted, but a 'W' specifier is only permitted when the bit number is less than 32.

definition.after: In assembler source code an 'X' specifier is always permitted, but a 'W' specifier is only permitted when the bit number is less than 32.
